trans-unit.source: DSC Service Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC Service Resource

trans-unit.source: powershell,DSC
trans-unit.target: powershell,DSC

trans-unit.source: DSC Service Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC Service Resource

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: The **Service** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage services on the target node.
trans-unit.target: The **Service** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage services on the target node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Indicates the service name.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the service name.

trans-unit.source: Note that sometimes this is different from the display name.
trans-unit.target: Note that sometimes this is different from the display name.

trans-unit.source: You can get a list of the services and their current state with the Get-Service cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can get a list of the services and their current state with the Get-Service cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: BuiltInAccount
trans-unit.target: BuiltInAccount

trans-unit.source: Indicates the sign-in account to use for the service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the sign-in account to use for the service.

trans-unit.source: The values that are allowed for this property are: **LocalService**, **LocalSystem**, and **NetworkService**.
trans-unit.target: The values that are allowed for this property are: **LocalService**, **LocalSystem**, and **NetworkService**.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: Indicates credentials for the account that the service will run under.
trans-unit.target: Indicates credentials for the account that the service will run under.

trans-unit.source: This property and the __BuiltinAccount__ property cannot be used together.
trans-unit.target: This property and the __BuiltinAccount__ property cannot be used together.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.

trans-unit.source: StartupType
trans-unit.target: StartupType

trans-unit.source: Indicates the startup type for the service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the startup type for the service.

trans-unit.source: The values that are allowed for this property are: **Automatic**, **Disabled**, and **Manual**
trans-unit.target: The values that are allowed for this property are: **Automatic**, **Disabled**, and **Manual**

trans-unit.source: State
trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.source: Indicates the state you want to ensure for the service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the state you want to ensure for the service.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Indicates the description of the target service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the description of the target service.

trans-unit.source: DisplayName
trans-unit.target: DisplayName

trans-unit.source: Indicates the display name of the target service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the display name of the target service.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the target service exists on the system.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the target service exists on the system.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to **Absent** to ensure that the target service does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to **Absent** to ensure that the target service does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Setting it to **Present** (the default value) ensures that target service exists.
trans-unit.target: Setting it to **Present** (the default value) ensures that target service exists.

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: Indicates the path to the binary file for a new service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the path to the binary file for a new service.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example
